reviews.title: Great sound !
text: Great sound, great location. Just loved it ! Easy to get inside, no lineups for beer and washrooms. My wife and I are constantly looking for concerts to go since then

reviews.title: It's worth the drive "to Acton".  Don't go here.
text: It is a shame one is not allowed to give a no star review.  Went to see a taping of the CBC show, The Debaters.  It was an enjoyable experience except for the fact that I could NOT sit down.  The seats are so tiny that the distance from my butt to my kneecap was significantly longer than the distance from the back of my seat to the back of the next one.  Additionally, the seats have rigid cup holders that cut your leg just below the knee.  I DON'T FIT.  That might be okay for 15 minutes but not for 3 hours.  Why 3 hours? Because all those complaints in other reviews about misleading start times are true.  The comments about the quality and behavior of the staff and "security" in those other reviews remain true.  THIS IS A GREAT PLACE TO AVOID.  Drive to Hamilton to see your show.  You will be a lot happier.

reviews.title: I love this venue for concerts. I’ve seen so many here!
text: I’ve seen so many shows here! Was last here a few months ago for the Electric Callboy show. I always have a good time here. When I was young I love the general admission area but in my late 20s and early 30s I love the balcony area. Sound is good as well. It loses a point because it can be a nightmare exiting the venue. That front room is very small.

reviews.title: Love this venue for concerts
text: Ive been to several concerts here and it’s definitely one of my favourite venues. It provides a more intimate feel than most similar venues and the slant in the floor is great in that no matter where you are or how tall you are you are sure to have a good view.

reviews.title: Not very good
text: Old building with great charm.  But very very hot and no air flow. Biggest problem I had was the heat my making you dehydrated very quickly and the venue was charging $4.25 for a bottle of PC water. The entire case of 24 only cost $3 -.$4 you can do better.  Had to stop the concert 3 times as I would believe people were over heated and had to be escorted out.

reviews.title: What a dump
text: Good concert but lousy venue. First have to go through the alleged “security” check where bags are opened a a cursory glance is given. However ALL water is made to be dumped out before entering. Doesn’t make sense does it-  we’re not getting on a plane here!!  But it does once you get in and have to pay $4 for a small bottle of water!!!!   Now I get it - it’s called gouging!  So I caved and purchased only to find out from another irate patron that if you ask they’ll kindly bestow upon you a cup of tap water. Maybe that could have been offered when I purchased by over priced bottle of tap water???   The venue is filthy. The women’s washroom was disgusting. The paint is peeling. There were holes in the walls (my seat was in the balcony and holes were visible if I looked up) the seat were uncomfortable, etc.

All I can say is that is you are going to gouge me $4 for water maybe the venue should reflect that type of price point. Niagara in the Lake theatres don’t  gouge you  $4 for water.    Good thing the music was excellent because nothing else was.

reviews.title: Fire the security staff immediately...
text: The venue is nice, but the security staff should be fired immediately. Targeting female concertgoers to kick out mid-show in a disgusting display of what can only be called a childlike desire for a power trip.

For context, I’m a male smoker, so I spent quite a bit of time outside near the front entrance to the venue for the New Years celebration with the band Dwayne Gretzky. I watched over and over as ALL of the security staff took turns kicking women out of the concert that they paid good money to attend. It was always under the guise of intoxication, but there wasn’t a SINGLE time where I saw this to be the case. They had a portable toilet set up outside with a shaky railing leading up the short stairway to the restroom doors. I watched men completely stumble down the stairs over and over again due to the railing giving out, and initially had this problem myself, but god forbid if you did this in HEELS! Over and over again this staff ignored occasions of actually drunk guys and targeted females who “talked back” upon hearing that their $80 night was over before the stroke of 12:00. They were LOOKING to kick people out, and they did it to so many women who had no business being ejected from a venue. It was gross. I watched the female security guard actually yell at a woman who had the audacity to WASH HER HANDS in the portable restroom! She told the young woman that she couldn’t wash her hands because they needed to keep the line moving and that she should “finish washing her hand in the water fountain outside”. WTF!!???? Again, this was in plane view of the front of the venue where they had the portable restroom truck setup, so the security displayed no shame in choosing power over the sanitation and health of the venue’s patrons.
This place needs to look in the mirror and grow up!  The concert was excellent, so it’s a shame to see children running the doors to this otherwise great venue.  Make a change!!

reviews.title: Decent Venue But A Bit Of A Dump
text: Went and saw the Trailer Park Boys - the sight lines are great and the sound is excellent, but the place is a bit of a dump.  Needs a make over, paint, cleaning, more toilets and better ways of selling merchandise than having people lined up on stairs.  And be careful of the seats - they aren't attached to the floor!  That said, I would definitely go if there was a show there that I wanted to see.

reviews.title: Security guards....true comedy
text: We came from out of town 2.5 hours to see the JJH show. It was great! We loved it. Very intimate venue. Perfect for this type of show...that’s about the only good thing I can say about the rest of the place as it is practically crumbling in on itself by not being maintained over the years.

Like others have mentioned, don’t bother looking at the time on your ticket if you have an assigned seat...Look online for the show start time and align your arrival with that...the doors don’t open when they say they will.

Another tip, they will stamp your hand and wrap a bracelet around you so you can drink - but - don’t dare leave the venue - a long brown haired girl will tell you that you can’t come back inside...even when explaining that you got separated from your boyfriend, are not from around here, didn’t know that there was no re-entry, look quite young and are 5ft tall. Go stand alone on the street at 1030pm in Toronto - on the Danforth...sounds safe....
Meanwhile JJH was having people line up for a book signing - the venue was not shutting down. Easy girl.
Thankfully, another security guard with a brain that could see through his given instruction set (square peg, square hole) and let me back inside since it was zero degrees outside...
Prices are also overkill. wine...$12 - there is an LCBO down the street - just brown bag it outside. You will have a buzz and feel less ashamed of yourself at the end of the day.
This place would likely be best off to burn to the ground so it can end its’ existence.

reviews.title: Surprisingly good
text: I didn’t know what to expect. I’ve seen shows at the sound academy, “koolhaus” (although it’s gone now), acc, Budweiser stage etc and this was a really positive experience for me.
Husband and I saw two door cinema club and it was so fun and awesome. Everyone seemed pretty low key and the venue was good! I would certainly see another show there!

reviews.title: Great venue
text: We we able to see Our Lady Peace do a rehearsal before there tour and it's a great venue.  Nice and small and lots of charm.  I would love to see it packed at a concert and enjoy the energy that this place would have.

reviews.title: No complaints
text: Went to LP's concert last night with friends. The space is good, the location is awesome when it comes to parking your car. Washrooms were clean. Staff was gentle. No complaints.

reviews.title: Great event space opn the Danforth.
text: Had not been to the Danforth Music Hall in some time but was there last night for Bananarama.  The acoustics are not great but it gets the job done but the general admission standing room space is graded and makes for a good view for everyone.  Alcohol is expensive but that is to be expected.  If there is a show that you want to see there I would recommend going as it is an opportunity to get up close and personal.  Would not recommend the seated area as it is far away from the stage and if you want to move (dance) hard to do!

reviews.title: Such a unique space!
text: We love coming to events here, because it is such a beautiful, old space. It has a lot of charm, and it's a really intimate place to see performers. There is even a small snack bar and bar area. Nice sound, too!

reviews.title: Riverdale share christmas event
text: This was my first time to the Riverdale share event, it was impressive to see the turn out at this charity event. They had a great line up of entertainers from local school kids to well known recording artists . Singers, comedy, and a good cause in a grand old venue

reviews.title: Might have been great once. It's not now.
text: Like another reviewer, I also read my ticket and hustled from out of town to get to the show on time - only to discover the time on the ticket has nothing to do with when the show actually starts - oh wait... I mean, the opening act - also not mentioned on the ticket. By the time the main show started, it was close to 10:00 and we'd been waiting since 7. Misleading is the word. I won't see a concert here again.

There are seats in the balconies, they are uncomfortable, and I guess, if you're ok standing for 5 hours, the main floor will do. Ticket price should be lower if you're standing for the duration is my thinking. Too bad because I felt like the hall had such great potential. Cool old space, historical relevance to the city - not going back.

reviews.title: Always a wonderful experience here!
text: This is my favourite concert venue in Toronto. It's large enough that some of the biggest performers have gigs here but intimate enough that even if you're sitting in the back, you can still see everything!
The staff are great and very professional.

reviews.title: The place is Electric...
text: Went last night to see Paul Weller and have been here several times over the past number of years. While the ground floor can be set up with seating, last night as per usual was General admission and packed in as standing room only... I had booked a seat in the balcony where with a birds eye view I could thoroughly enjoy the evening. We always enjoy the DMH... service at the bar(s) is always friendly and the place has such a terrific atmosphere - with the peeling paint and old world feel. The sound mix was as good as ever. I wish we went more often as it is a great venue offering a boundless variety of performers. Can't wait to go again in December...

reviews.title: I'll never go to this venue
text: I'm never, ever going back. The venue's sound is worse than awful. I've been there to see Nick Murphy (Chet Faker), an outstanding artist, in a concert and I could not hear his voice, let alone understanding the lyrics. The sound system was distorting, unbalanced, and all set on high decibels.

reviews.title: Intimate Night of Music
text: This is an older theatre that is standing room only on the main floor and some seating in the mezzanine and balcony.  Great spot for a concert as you're never too far away from the stage and the sound is good.  The theatre is licensed with lots of access for a cold drink to enjoy the show.  Also, take advantage of MANY local restaurants on the Danforth nearby before the show - parking can be a challenge, but food won't be.

reviews.title: Historic venue with something for everyone
text: We recently saw The Tea Party and were sitting up in the balcony. The seats were quite comfortable and steep enough to see the stage. The staff was pleasant and helpful. Long lineup at the bathroom, but that's always the situation at concert events. I enjoyed the feeling of history and the lovely architecture.

reviews.title: Very well looked after!
text: My husband and I had gone to the Danforth Music Hall to see SOFI TUKKER Oct.16, 2018.  I use an upright walker, wheelchair or brace crutch for mobility and in the past, we have purchased tickets in the balcony as I need to sit for the majority of the show. We were aware that the venue did not have an elevator to balcony. Last night I had used my upright walker which my husband planned on carrying up to the balcony while I used my crutch to tackle the stairs. I was very pleased when a security guard offered and escorted us to an area on the floor, side stage with a barrier and pulled out a folding chair for myself. I can’t begin to tell you how wonderful it was to be able to see the stage, not get shoved around and to be able to sit for the entire concert!  The Security Staff even cleared a path for us to leave the hall once the concert was over. Thank you Danforth Music Hall for having a plan to assist patrons with mobility devices and to the Security Staff for going above and beyond. We will Definitely be back!

reviews.title: Nice venue, unique ambiance
text: I attended the Proclaimers concert with a friend.  We had seats in the Balcony row LL.  The view was decent but front row of the balcony would have been better. We unfortunately had someone a few rows up stand up and dance (when everyone else was sitting) during "500 miles", thereby blocking the view of everyone behind her.  If you need parking, either come early or be prepared to walk a bit. we were fortunate enough to find curbside parking (free!) around the corner on Broadview.  Overall the venue is good and I'd definitely consider it for a show in the future.

reviews.title: Okay venue
text: Came here to see RuPaul’s Werq the World tour. Here’s my thoughts on this venue:
Pros: staff were friendly and professional, and kept lines moving. The slanted floor in the standing room area making for decent viewing.

Cons: drink prices are extortionate. There were some production issues with the show (part of the state had no spotlight, so performers were in the dark sometimes. Sound was okay. Low perceived value for the ticket price

reviews.title: New Beer Prices at the Music Hall
text: Saw the King Gizzard show there on June 12th 2018. The Music Hall has now instituted stadium beer prices - tall boy cans are $11 each for domestic and $12 for imports. Come out and get gouged!
If you cross the road between band sets you can get two beers for the price of one at the Hall.

reviews.title: Intimate with a touch of class
text: The Danforth music hall seats around 1200 people depending on the configuration.  The building shows it's age, but you are never too far from the performer.  Seating is clearly marked, and from what I was able to see, obstructions were not an issue.  Mens and ladies facilities are on the small side, so use the washroom at the restaurant before you leave for your show :)
Concessions serve basic snacks and alcohol.  Parking is plentiful nearby with Toronto's green P parking system.

reviews.title: So cool.
text: I really enjoyed going to Danforth, I personally went to see the Aunty Donna boys. Comedy group. But to be able to see a concert here would be so cool!

reviews.title: Great Place to See "Celebrating David Bowie"
text: This concert hall was a fun place to see this show.  It could use restoration and does not accept credit cards for beverages.  We opted for seats rather than standing for the show.  The seats were comfortable.  The sound was good.

The nearby city parking however was a concern.  The paid parking allows people to buy specific blocks of time rather than just purchasing a given amount of hours.  This is problematic if you opt to have dinner.  We ate at Allen's next door and one person in our party had to leave his dinner just as it arrived to pay for parking from 6:00 pm.  If we would have purchased based upon the time that we needed, it would have cost us over $40.  I mention this because if the show at this theater begins before 6:00, you may end up with an expensive ticket if you cannot leave the venue.

reviews.title: Brett kissel
text: I seen the Brett Kissel concert here. The show was great and I loved that the floor was on an angle. Allowing shorter people to see over the people in front of them. The ladies washroom got a huge line but it’s not the establishments fault.

reviews.title: OMD
text: The concert was AMAZING and the staff at the venue were very professional, helpful and cheerful. I liked that they informed concert-goers that there's no smoking of any kind at the facility and people respected that. I've been to concerts at the ACC where the no smoking bylaws were just ignored and people were smoking cigarettes and weed and no one intervened or made sure that the they stop. It was a bit difficult to find parking at first as the green p parking lots in the area were quite small and very full but then I discovered the Loblaws parking nearby (even closer than the green P lots) where you can pay a reasonable price and park for the evening.  Had a wonderful time and hope to see OMD again in the near future!!!

reviews.title: Power tripping security
text: This place has horrible security. I came here for a concert in April and the security decided to harass me and my three friends for an hour for absolutely no reason. Literally 9 or 10 security guards yelling profanity at us and acting like they were some kind of gang. The one guy was yelling in my face and when I told him he was scaring me he grabbed my purse and dumped the contents in front of the venue. The security acts like rock and metal concerts are some kind of social event for them where they can do whatever they want. It was really pathetic and I still think about it, we drove from hours away just to get harassed.

reviews.title: Get a new audio engineer
text: I went here to see While She Sleeps and Architects play. Good job making good bands sound like awful. Way too much low end and kick drum on all of the bands that played. Lead guitar as well as vocals were completely inaudible most of the time and bass overpowered everything to the point of actually clipping. This issue was present on all three bands that played and only got slightly better for the last set.
Wont be coming back!

reviews.title: Good place for a rock show!
text: We saw Steven Page at the Danforth in May 2019. It was a seated GA show. Great show, great sound. The bar had a good beer selection, but was cash only.

reviews.title: Totally awesome
text: Great experience all except the lineup but that’s expected at a concert right?
Staff are friendly and attentive
Sound is great and stage view was perfect
Definitely going back!

reviews.title: Good venue
text: Nice sized venue. We enjoyed seeing a few of our favorite bands here. Sound was good. We found drinks to be way over priced. People would buy more if prices were a little lower.

reviews.title: Good Concert Venue
text: This old fashioned  music hall has class high ceilings. Front area is for standing while back section is seated balcony. Good acoustics. They have a good line up of performers scheduled.

reviews.title: General admission concert
text: Attended on a Thursday night for a rock show. Parking was a bit sparse as both nearby Green P lots were full, but ended up finding the lot at Loblaws around the corner for $5.

The general admission section has a sightly sloped floor and was perfect for us. The balcony section was more of a distance from the stage than I imagined. Drinks are served on both the west/east side of floor. Restrooms were fair condition. Egress was a bit bottlenecked with only a couple options but cleared reasonably quick.
Sound quality was better than expected and overall nothing flashy but good venue for a show.

reviews.title: A Place of old & new Moments
text: Saw Casey Musgraves recently & she preformed great.  The music hall was okay but was designed years back as a theatre.

reviews.title: Terrible Customer Service
text: I called the Music Hall with what I thought was a pretty simple question and never was able to talk to anyone there.  I called their listed  number morning, afternoon, and evening and always got the same recording, with no opportunity to leave a voice message. I sent an e-mail inquiry, as suggested on the recording, again with no reply.  I then called another phone number I found on their website, again with no answer.  Finally, I sent individual e-mails to both the General Mgr. and Assistant Mgr - no one has replied.  This is terrible customer service - they obviously don't care about their customers once they get the money for the tickets.

reviews.title: TPOH/Odds Concert Review
text: Just saw two historic Canadian bands at the Danforth Music Hall, which remains my favourite venue to see a show in Toronto. The venue size, google estimate says it holds 1500, allows for a biggest small show in Toronto feel. As the floor in front of the very large stage being on an incline makes viewing the performers super easy to maneuver to get a good view. I was able to walk right up to the front of the stage as the open layout of the venue (no seats on the main level) allows for easy walkings to get a beer/use the washroom even when crowded. The sound was great for each rock act that came on and as was announced at another show I attended, the venue appears to have a hard-stop at 11:00 pm so the acts came on promptly at 8 and 9:15 respectively. It created a nice energized vibe as no one was struggling with a long night and the sound was crisp. Would definitely recommend.
